intro: Cymopterus grayanus, commonly known as Gray's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. Cymopterus grayanus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
